Topic.Title: Oh, we've waited all right. Now down in AH on FB "earnings". YHOO should not have chickened out in patent....

Message.Msg: much better patents than aol? of the several thousand patents that yahoo has they came up with only 12 of any use in the suit! many expert patent attorney's stated that several would of been thrown out of court because they should of never been issued by the patent dept.! several others would of been reduced in language to be meaningless etc.! of course- we must remember that fb had a couple (out of their 10) that covered 80% of yahoo's revenue! in addition-the suit could of drag on for years & years with unbelievable cost & not helping their reputation or building a reliance with fb during that time. many on this board indicating that yahoo patents couldn't be worth much since nobody is ( to their knowledge ) bidding for them! i've stated (on record) many times that fb would NOT settle unless it was to their advantage & esp. with yahoo after they reneged on their potential buy out of fb. also i stated that numerous patent attorneys indicated that (if won by yahoo) the amount would of been no where near the huge figures mentioned on this board! remember- or you don't want to since you totally disagreed! i'm sure the board (including loeb) & their legal staff weighed all the positives & negatives & felt the settlement was the best for the company! you have (like me) no knowledge whatsoever on the merits of these patents (plus including all other considerations) so how do you know what they would of recovered? by the way it's not like fb couldn't hold off for years since last observed they had around 11 billion cash & bought many additional patents!

Message.Title: Take away all the stupid thecoldone (and his many ids) posts, and stupid hotmodel post too, and.....
Message.Msg: ...there is nothing on this board. FB down to the $22's and yet YHOO is their #$%$ and gave up patent suits for empty promises. YHOO still has more revenues and much more profits (and great growth stakes in Asia) yet is worth about 1/3 of FB!

yahoo looks all set for a move up...but then again it has for months...just waiting on Asian funds, clear partnerships, and a plan of action.....meanwhile FB is getting absolutely crushed today....the fanatic supporters are running for the exits...now what will their insiders do....many may have to sell shares to cover the taxes....they should have made shares a long term investment and not actually transferred title up front but over a period of years. Now they have a double cliff of panic among the common shareholders and insiders who may have to sell. Insider buying at Yahoo! is good - I hope it continues, and that they use some of their cash to buy back shares to decrease the float and increase the share price.
it has done so...will it close over $16?
